job_title: Adjunct IT Instructor in San Jose, CA
Faculty Member in San Diego, CA
pros: Laurus College is an amazing company to work for. The owners care about the quality of education that our students receive, and they also care about their employees. Our leadership team achieves organizational objectives; with employees who give their personal best and work together as a team/family in an environment of trust. It is the best place to work.
cons: Nothing. Everything is great at Laurus College.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Amazing students, while online the classes are still live, great faculty, amazing student services staff

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Santa Maria, CA
pros:
Work from home
Good benefits
Flexible schedule

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros:
Look forward to coming to work every day. (6+ years)
The faculty is great to work with and so is the administration!
The company's focus is a quality experience and quality education which shows during student and faculty interaction.
Laurus College has a very friendly corporate culture with some nice perks for employees.
I would recommend Laurus College to friends and family for employment and education!
cons: No real cons just a great friendly rewarding place of employment that will support its staff in any way possible!

job_title: Instructor in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: I love coming to work! All of the employees and students are great to work with. The job is very rewarding and management is friendly and supportive. The overall corporate culture is focused on providing a quality experience and quality education. Program directors work well with instructors to develop industry leading education. Teaching in a brick and mortar and online synchronous environment is exciting. Classes change every 5 weeks which keeps teaching from becoming monotonous.  I truly enjoy working at Laurus College.
cons: I have no complaints about Laurus College and love developing a cutting edge way to deliver education.

pros:
A good level of academic freedom. 

Family business, so you can get to know everyone. 

Great co-workers from all departments.

Very interesting pushing boundaries in education with real-time web-based classrooms.
cons:
Pay is low. 

Some employees in smaller departments have their shifts change every term (5 weeks). Day, then night, then split. Unpredictable because nobody knows what their schedule will be the next term. 

There are several very different programs available, but administration is 'one size fits all'.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Santa Maria, CA
pros: Laurus College is passionate about helping students succeed in the real world!  It's very rewarding to work for a college that puts it's students and employees above all else. I would highly recommend this company to anyone looking for a great and ethical company to work for!
cons: I can't think of any cons.

review_title: An amazingly awesome company to work for.
job_title: Member of the Animation Department in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: The company provides many opportunities for its employees to grow within the company and typically promotes from within the organization.  I was hired on as a teacher’s assistant and over the course of eight years I was promoted numerous times.  I have always felt appreciated by the management team and that the work I'm assigned is important and meaningful.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about Laurus College, or its management team.

pros: Balance between a fun work environment and achievement of the goals of the organization.  Everyone has a commitment to student success above everything else.  Employees are treated fairly and with respect.  People go out of their way to help others reach their goals ~ a true family of an organization!
cons: Hard to identify any specific cons.  Laurus staff and faculty are dedicated to the mission of the organization making it a great place to be involved with.

review_title: Excellent company with a friendly, hardworking atmosphere
pros: Laurus College has been a terrific company to work for. Each team member is dedicated to the organization's mission statement, "to provide every student with a quality education and a quality experience." The family friendly culture allows easy interaction and authenticity with each individual within the company.
cons: No cons. Would like to see the family friendly environment maintain and keep adding individuals who make this place great!

job_title: Student Services in Santa Maria, CA
pros: I am grateful to say I have been with Laurus College for a long time. I have been supported in my career and have been able to grow within the school under the supervision of great directors and mentors. I could not ask for a better working environment!
cons: I have not experienced anything negative during my time as a Laurus College employee.  The Laurus College culture thrives as our staff and student body continue to grow.

pros: The students are all great!!!  I had much fun there with other students, I made friends for liife.
cons: I wish I had of took Nursing instead of IT if I was younger IT would of been great however you must move on to a higer education to get a good job.

cons: I do not have any complaints working for Laurus College.  I do not have any complaints working for Laurus College.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in San Diego, CA

review_title: Getting back into the job market

cons: I wish the opportunity would have lasted longer.
